bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 27, 1900

div1.p: Lazear writes that he received a telegram announcing his daughter's birth. He hopes for a vacation in the United States in October.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 27, 1900
div1.p:
I was glad
to get your letter of
the 17th, and to know
that the weather was
good and that you
were out of doors
a good deal.

I got the telegram on
Friday announcing
the birth of a daughter
but there has not been
time for a letter
to arrive. I am of
course very anxious to
learn all the particulars,
especially as to how
Mabel is getting
along. I ought to
get some word by
day after tomorrow.
The distance seems
very great at a time
like this.

I am pretty lose I
can get my vacation
some time late in
October, but I shall
not be able to stay
long in the States.
I am trying to have
some changes made in our
quarters here so that it will
be more comfortable for
Mabel.

I have a good deal of driving
around over rough roads
just now and I am usually
pretty tired in the eacuring
